alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 6:18PM CDT until April 13 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR WESTERN LAFAYETTE...NORTHWESTERN YALOBUSHA...TALLAHATCHIE... SOUTHEASTERN QUITMAN AND PANOLA COUNTIES... At 618 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Como to near Batesville to Webb, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Batesville, Charleston, George Payne State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Como, Crowder, Webb, Sumner, Pope, Enid, Paynes, Harmontown, Burgess, Oakland, Courtland, Taylor and Glendora. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
